reviews.review: I smelled the ashes and it was great

So after finishing Half Life 1 for the first time last month, I obviously went straight onto Half Life 2 but in between I watched a full playthrough of Half Life Alyx to obviously get ahead on her prequel story before starting 2 which made more sense to me while playing through HL2.

HL2 is just as fun of a first person shooter as HL1 but with a little more meat on it in terms of visuals, gameplay and characters/plot. I really enjoyed the game as a whole, the only gripe I have with it is that the travelling from City 17 to escape to Nova Prospekt was really long but the Ravenholm section broke it up a bit at least. Saying that it felt right and as it should for Gordon being on the run, the firefights were cool as f**k from masses of Combine forces, taking down huge gunships and Strider battles! I liked meeting all of the rebellion members along the way helping them fend off the Combine and how Breen adapted the technology/creatures of the Xen to fight for him besides the obvious sentient Vortigaunt slaves that joined the rebellion.

All in all it was a very good game with the obvious [spoiler]open ended[/spoiler] ending and leaving me with more questions than answer. Congrats, Valve. Giving me blue balls twice in two consecutive months AND I haven't even played Chapter 1, 2 and Lost Coast yet which are supposed to add an entirely new twist to the ending of HL2 ;/

10/10 (I also played the original version, not the HL2: Update)

For many years I owned this game. For many years I played through, over and over, but not ever getting near the end. When I heard about Half-Life Alyx, I knew I had to finish the game for real. I restarted the game for one last time and charged through. Hours and hours, I hunted down the caches, hours and hours I trudged through the horrors of the city and its outskirts. When I finally hit the end, it felt so good. To finally have this game under my belt as completed. I highly recommend that anybody who doesnt already have this game, please do yourself a favour and get it already.

Half-Life 2, when it came out in 2004, was groundbreaking for it's physics engine and it's graphics / story. In my honest opinion, these claims still hold true even in the year 2020. If you have never played HL2 before, give it a chance. You won't forget it.

Took me a few times to actually sit down and play the game all the way through, due to a slow start, but when I did I was pleasantly surprised at how intuitive the levels were, how well the story was portrayed and understood, and how generally enjoyable the pacing was. It took about 10.5 hours to beat the game at what I would consider a pretty decent clip.

The major gripe I have with HL2 is the zombie portions of the game, namely Ravenholm. They slow the game down to a crawl and tend to be very annoying, the enemies are loud and obnoxious, the poison headcrabs can nearly one-shot you, and the music and atmosphere of the game goes from ominous and intense to nonexistent or boring. I can see what they were going for but for me it really missed its mark.

Reaching the end of the game and looking back at the start and into the middle of the game, it almost feels like it was an entirely different genre, which I really enjoyed. Just as puzzles start to get boring, the game lets you loose with your shotgun and pulse rifle, as that gets sort of old the game introduces new enemies or characters that are immediately likeable or at least interesting, the changes in scenery were just often enough to let you get used to it but not so much as to get old or maze-like, overall I definitely see why this game is hailed as a masterpiece, but perhaps a bit of cult following exaggerated my expectations. A solid title with fun puzzle elements, tight controls and unique weaponry, and an enjoyable story. 

7.5/10

Half-Life. Gra która zrewolucjonizowała rynek gier. Po sześciu latach od jej wydania, światło dzienne ujrzał sequel - Half-Life 
2. Gra zaskakuje swoją pomysłowością, ale także niezapomnianym klimatem terenów postsowieckich. Po wydarzeniach z "jedynki", Gordon Freeman budzi się w świecie terroryzowanym przez tajemniczy Kombinat. Dąży on do zniszczenia rasy ludzkiej. Pierwszy raz został tu wykorzystany silnik Source, który posiadał jak na 2004 rok zaawansowaną fizykę. Przejście gry zajęło mi ok. 8 godzin. Gra warta swoich pieniędzy (35,99 zł). Daje 10/10. Miłej zabawy!
